00025 void *s_klthreadstart(void* vid)
00026 {
00027         ((Sequencer*)vid)->killerthreadstart();
00028         return NULL;
00029 }
00030 
00031 
00032 Sequencer::Sequencer(char *pubip, int max_clients, char* servname, char* terrname, int listenport, int smode, char *pass)
00033 {
00034         pthread_mutex_init(&killer_mutex, NULL);
00035         pthread_cond_init(&killer_cv, NULL);
00036         pthread_mutex_init(&clients_mutex, NULL);
00037         
00038         freekillqueue=0;
00039         servermode=smode;
00040         pthread_create(&killerthread, NULL, s_klthreadstart, this);
00041         fuid=1;
00042         notifier=0;
00043         maxclients=max_clients;
00044         clients=(client_t*)malloc(sizeof(client_t)*maxclients);
00045         for (int i=0; i<maxclients; i++) 
00046         {
00047                 clients[i].status=FREE;
00048                 clients[i].broadcaster=new Broadcaster(this);
00049                 clients[i].receiver=new Receiver(this);
00050         }
00051 
00052         listener=new Listener(listenport, this);
00053 
00054         bool pwprotected = false;
00055         if(pass && strnlen(pass,250)>0)
00056                 pwprotected = true;
00057 
00058         if(servermode == SERVER_INET || servermode == SERVER_AUTO)
00059                 notifier=new Notifier(pubip, listenport, this, max_clients, servname, terrname, pwprotected, servermode);
00060 }
00061 
00062 Sequencer::~Sequencer(void)
00063 {
00064         for (int i=0; i<maxclients && &clients[i]; i++) 
00065         {
00066                 logmsgf(LOG_DEBUG,"clients[%d]", i);
00067                 if(clients[i].broadcaster){
00068                         logmsgf(LOG_DEBUG,"delete clients[%d].broadcaster", i);
00069                         delete clients[i].broadcaster;
00070                 } else { 
00071                         logmsgf(LOG_DEBUG,"clients[%d].broadcaster is null", i);
00072                 }
00073 
00074                 if(clients[i].receiver) {
00075                         logmsgf(LOG_DEBUG,"delete clients[%d].receiver", i); 
00076                         delete clients[i].receiver;
00077                 } else { 
00078                         logmsgf(LOG_DEBUG,"clients[%d].receiver is null", i);
00079                 }
00080         }
00081         if(notifier) delete notifier;
00082         delete listener;
00083         free(clients);
00084 }
00085 
00086 void Sequencer::notifyRoutine()
00087 {
00088         //we call the notify loop
00089         notifier->loop();
00090 }
00091 
00092 //this is called by the Listener thread
00093 void Sequencer::createClient(SWInetSocket *sock, char* name)
00094 {
00095         //we have a confirmed client that wants to play
00096         //try to find a place for him
00097         pthread_mutex_lock(&clients_mutex);
00098         int pos=0;
00099         for (pos=0; pos<maxclients; pos++) if (clients[pos].status==FREE) break;
00100         if (pos==maxclients)
00101         {
00102                 pthread_mutex_unlock(&clients_mutex);
00103                 Messaging::sendmessage(sock, MSG2_FULL, 0, 0, 0);
00104                 sock->disconnect();
00105                 return;
00106         }
00107         
00108         //okay, create the stuff
00109         clients[pos].flow=false;
00110         clients[pos].status=USED;
00111         clients[pos].vehicle_name[0]=0;
00112         clients[pos].position=Vector3(0,0,0);
00113         strncpy(clients[pos].nickname, name, 21);
00114         clients[pos].uid=fuid;
00115         fuid++;
00116         clients[pos].sock=sock;
00117         clients[pos].receiver->reset(pos, sock); //this won't interlock
00118         clients[pos].broadcaster->reset(pos, sock); //this won't interlock
00119         pthread_mutex_unlock(&clients_mutex);
00120         Messaging::sendmessage(sock, MSG2_WELCOME, clients[pos].uid, 0, 0);
00121         logmsgf(LOG_DEBUG,"Sequencer: New client created in slot %i", pos);
00122         printStats();
00123 }
00124 
00125 //this is called from the hearbeat notifier thread
00126 int Sequencer::getHeartbeatData(char *challenge, char *hearbeatdata)
00127 {
00128         pthread_mutex_lock(&clients_mutex);
00129         int clientnum =0;
00130         for (int i=0; i<maxclients; i++) if (clients[i].status!=FREE) clientnum++;
00131 
00132         sprintf(hearbeatdata, "%s\n" \
00133                               "version1\n" \
00134                               "%i\n", challenge, clientnum);
00135         if(clientnum > 0)
00136         {
00137                 for (int i=0; i<maxclients; i++)
00138                 {
00139                         if (clients[i].status != FREE)
00140                         {
00141                                 char playerdata[1024] = "";
00142                                 char positiondata[128] = "";
00143                                 clients[i].position.toString(positiondata);
00144                                 sprintf(playerdata, "%d;%s;%s;%s\n", i, clients[i].vehicle_name, clients[i].nickname, positiondata);
00145                                 strcat(hearbeatdata, playerdata);
00146                         }
00147                 }
00148         }
00149         pthread_mutex_unlock(&clients_mutex);
00150         return 0;
00151 }
00152 
00153 int Sequencer::getNumClients()
00154 {
00155         int count=0;
00156         pthread_mutex_lock(&clients_mutex);
00157         for (int i=0; i<maxclients; i++) if (clients[i].status!=FREE) count++;
00158         pthread_mutex_unlock(&clients_mutex);
00159         return count;
00160 }
00161 
00162 void Sequencer::killerthreadstart()
00163 {
00164         logmsgf(LOG_DEBUG,"Killer thread ready");
00165         while (1)
00166         {
00167                 SWBaseSocket::SWBaseError error;
00168 
00169                 logmsgf(LOG_DEBUG,"Killer entering cycle");
00170 
00171                 pthread_mutex_lock(&killer_mutex);
00172                 while (freekillqueue==0)
00173                         pthread_cond_wait(&killer_cv, &killer_mutex);
00174                 //pop the kill queue
00175                 int pos=killqueue[0];
00176                 freekillqueue--;
00177                 memcpy(killqueue, &killqueue[1], sizeof(int)*freekillqueue);
00178                 pthread_mutex_unlock(&killer_mutex);
00179 
00180                 logmsgf(LOG_DEBUG,"Killer called to kill %i", pos);
00181                 pthread_mutex_lock(&clients_mutex); //this won't interlock unless
00182                                                                                         //disconnect is called from a clients_mutex owning thread
00183                 logmsgf(LOG_DEBUG,"Killer got clients lock");
00184                 if (clients[pos].status==USED)
00185                 {
00186                         clients[pos].status=BUSY;
00187                         logmsgf(LOG_DEBUG,"Killer notifying");
00188                         //notify the others
00189                         for (int i=0; i<maxclients; i++)
00190                         {
00191                                 if (clients[i].status==USED && strlen(clients[i].vehicle_name)>0)
00192                                 {
00193                                         clients[i].broadcaster->queueMessage(clients[pos].uid, MSG2_DELETE, 0, 0);
00194                                 }
00195                         }
00196                         logmsgf(LOG_DEBUG,"Killer done notifying");
00197                         //we release the mutex now
00198                         pthread_mutex_unlock(&clients_mutex);
00199 
00200                         //things are less critical, we can take time to cleanup properly and synchronously
00201                         logmsgf(LOG_DEBUG,"Killer force disconnect");
00202                         clients[pos].sock->disconnect(&error);
00203                         logmsgf(LOG_DEBUG,"Killer stopping receiver");
00204                         clients[pos].receiver->stop();
00205                         logmsgf(LOG_DEBUG,"Killer stopping broadcaster");
00206                         clients[pos].broadcaster->stop();
00207                         logmsgf(LOG_DEBUG,"Killer deleting socket");
00208                         delete clients[pos].sock;
00209                         pthread_mutex_lock(&clients_mutex); 
00210                         logmsgf(LOG_DEBUG,"Killer got second clients lock");
00211                         clients[pos].status=FREE;
00212                 }
00213                 pthread_mutex_unlock(&clients_mutex);
00214                 logmsgf(LOG_DEBUG,"Killer has properly killed %i", pos);
00215         }
00216 }
00217 
00218 void Sequencer::disconnect(int pos, char* errormsg)
00219 {
00220         //this routine is a potential trouble maker as it can be called from many thread contexts
00221         //so we use a killer thread
00222         logmsgf(LOG_DEBUG,"ERROR Disconnecting Slot %d: %s", pos, errormsg);
00223         pthread_mutex_lock(&killer_mutex);
00224         //first check if not already queued
00225         bool found=false;
00226         for (int i=0; i<freekillqueue; i++) if (killqueue[i]==pos) {found=true; break;};
00227         if (!found)
00228         {
00229                 killqueue[freekillqueue]=pos;
00230                 freekillqueue++;
00231                 pthread_cond_signal(&killer_cv);
00232         }
00233         pthread_mutex_unlock(&killer_mutex);
00234 }
00235 
00236 //this is called from the listener thread initial handshake
00237 void Sequencer::enableFlow(int pos)
00238 {
00239         pthread_mutex_lock(&clients_mutex);
00240         clients[pos].flow=true;
00241         pthread_mutex_unlock(&clients_mutex);
00242 }
00243 
00244 //this is called from the listener thread initial handshake
00245 void Sequencer::notifyAllVehicles(int pos)
00246 {
00247         pthread_mutex_lock(&clients_mutex);
00248         for (int i=0; i<maxclients; i++)
00249         {
00250                 if (i!=pos && clients[i].status==USED && strlen(clients[i].vehicle_name)>0)
00251                 {
00252                         char message[512];
00253                         strcpy(message, clients[i].vehicle_name);
00254                         strcpy(message+strlen(clients[i].vehicle_name)+1, clients[i].nickname);
00255                         clients[pos].broadcaster->queueMessage(clients[i].uid, MSG2_USE_VEHICLE, message, (int)(strlen(clients[i].vehicle_name)+strlen(clients[i].nickname))+2);
00256                 }
00257         }
00258         pthread_mutex_unlock(&clients_mutex);
00259 }
00260 
00261 //this is called by the receivers threads, like crazy & concurrently
00262 void Sequencer::queueMessage(int pos, int type, char* data, unsigned int len)
00263 {
00264         pthread_mutex_lock(&clients_mutex);
00265         if (type==MSG2_USE_VEHICLE) 
00266         {
00267                 data[len]=0;
00268                 strncpy(clients[pos].vehicle_name, data, 129);
00269                 logmsgf(LOG_DEBUG,"On the fly vehicle registration for slot %d: %s", pos, clients[pos].vehicle_name);
00270                 //printStats();
00271                 //we alter the message to add user info
00272                 strcpy(data+len+1, clients[pos].nickname);
00273                 len+=(int)strlen(clients[pos].nickname)+2;
00274         }
00275         if (type==MSG2_VEHICLE_DATA)
00276         {
00277                 float* fpt=(float*)(data+sizeof(oob_t));
00278                 clients[pos].position=Vector3(fpt[0], fpt[1], fpt[2]);
00279         }
00280         if (type==MSG2_FORCE)
00281         {
00282                 //this message is to be sent to only one destination
00283                 unsigned int destuid=((netforce_t*)data)->target_uid;
00284                 for (int i=0; i<maxclients; i++)
00285                 {
00286                         if (clients[i].status==USED && clients[i].flow && clients[i].uid==destuid)
00287                                 clients[i].broadcaster->queueMessage(clients[pos].uid, type, data, len);
00288                 }
00289         }
00290         else
00291         {
00292                 //just push to all the present clients
00293                 for (int i=0; i<maxclients; i++)
00294                 {
00295                         if (clients[i].status==USED && clients[i].flow && i!=pos)
00296                                 clients[i].broadcaster->queueMessage(clients[pos].uid, type, data, len);
00297 #ifdef REFLECT_DEBUG
00298                         if (clients[i].status==USED && i==pos)
00299                                 clients[i].broadcaster->queueMessage(clients[pos].uid+100, type, data, len);
00300 #endif
00301                 }
00302         }
00303         pthread_mutex_unlock(&clients_mutex);
00304 }
00305 
00306 void Sequencer::printStats()
00307 {
00308         SWBaseSocket::SWBaseError error;
00309         printf("Server occupancy:\n");
00310         printf("Slot Status   UID IP              Nickname, Vehicle\n");
00311         printf("--------------------------------------------------\n");
00312         pthread_mutex_lock(&clients_mutex);
00313         for (int i=0; i<maxclients; i++)
00314         {
00315                 printf("%4i", i);
00316                 if (clients[i].status==FREE) printf(" Free\n");
00317                 else if (clients[i].status==BUSY)
00318                         printf(" Busy %5i %-16s %s, %s\n", clients[i].uid, "-", clients[i].nickname, clients[i].vehicle_name);
00319                 else 
00320                         printf(" Used %5i %-16s %s, %s\n", clients[i].uid, clients[i].sock->get_peerAddr(&error).c_str(), clients[i].nickname, clients[i].vehicle_name);
00321         }
00322         pthread_mutex_unlock(&clients_mutex);
00323 }
